intro: Solanum ukerewense, commonly known as the Ukerewe tomato, is a flowering plant native to the Ukerewe Island in Lake Victoria, Tanzania. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like potatoes and peppers. The plant produces small, yellow or orange fruits that are edible and used in local cuisines. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soil and adequate sunlight. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially valuable species for botanical research.
